title: Preventable circulatory mortality, Northern Ireland
creator: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/northern-ireland-statistics-and-research-agency
summary: Age-standardised mortality rate from circulatory diseases considered preventable for those aged under 75 per 100,000 population (2019 definition), Northern Ireland, 2001 to 2022.
description:
This dataset shows the age-standardised mortality rate from circulatory diseases considered preventable for those aged under 75 per 100,000 population (2019 definition), in Northern Ireland, for 2001 to 2022.

### Coverage 

Northern Ireland

#### Geography definition

Local Government Districts,
Nation (Northern Ireland) 

### Source

 - Northern Ireland: [Northern Ireland Statistics and Research Agency (NISRA)](https://www.health-ni.gov.uk/publications/age-standardised-death-rate-preventable-cardiovascular-disease-by-local-government-2001-2022) 


### Source Notes and Caveats 
- All figures up to and including 2011 are based on the 2011 Census mid-year population estimates. 
- All figures from 2012 onward are based on the 2021 Census mid-year population estimates. 
- The 2021 data point for this indicator covers the COVID-19 pandemic period, it will include any effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. 
- Rates presented are based on year of death registration, not year of occurrence.

measure.label: Age-standardised mortality rate for those aged under 75
